bow: mommy fail as was backing out of the garage today my toddler and baby in the back seat was giving myself mental pat on the back for getting everyone out of the house so smoothly then heard my toddler say mommy not buckled in could fall out of my seat 🤦‍♀️ mommy fail anyone else have good parenting fail moments to share mess up lot but hey tomorrow is another chance to try to do better haha once when my teenager was an infant took her into the grocery store in her infant car seat thing called it bucket it was warm in the store so unbuckled her and opened up her coat did my shopping put her bucket into the latch base thing and drove home when was getting her out of the car realized that had never buckled her back up fortunately nothing happened to us the store was only mile or two away never unbuckled her in the bucket again lol did that once too and drove long way breastfed baby in the backseat plonked her into her car seat when was done with the intention of going around to the other door to strap her in bit easier and somehow forgot and got straight into the front seat instead was very sleep deprived at the time and felt terrible so lucky there wasn an accident was thinking of another example and then thought of an even worse one have made so many mistakes and lie awake at night worrying about them ve done the same thing at least it the toddler who can tell you mine was my toddler as well did this the other day and while still parked heard little voice very close to my ear go hi mommy dude climbed out and came in for hug from behind and absolutely terrified me picked friend up from school and had couple minutes between bringing her to work so we sat in her schools parking lot but my daughter was there and she wanted to her dd she takes her out and realize had to bring her to work now so start driving away while my friend is in the backseat holding my daughter was only half way out of my parking spot but still funny did this once also sat her on top of her base sitting sideways so she was looking out the window buckled into her carseat but not actually attached to the base both were so horrible afterwards thinking about all of the things that could have happened became very careful about checking every step once made like blocks before realizing mine was buckled once ve done this before thankfully my son did the same thing mom you forgot to buckle me we have really cool machine that makes formula for us at whatever oz we need and whatever temp we need made bottle for my husband to feed the baby and was tired hand him the bottle and the baby starts drinking and freak out and grab the bottle the machine was out of formula and didn notice so gave him straight water and the baby was like months old when the doctors say to not give them water was sleep deprived and exhausted and cried and thought was the worst mom ever lol now looking back want to hug past me and say that nothing did this today my boy got attacked by ants and was so focused on that *situation* made it halfway out of the neighborhood before realizing when my baby was two months old my mom picked us up to take us to dr appointment and she buckled him into his infant seat but didn buckle the infant seat into the car she didn realize it until we were halfway there 😣😣😣 ve done that my husband and loaded her in her car seat and she started fussing so took look and said oh we didn buckle her in that was the last time that happened ve done this exact thing only was already flying down the highway when my toddler exclaimed that she wasn buckled panicked and then felt like massive failure more like mommy win because your kids are trained to notice when they re not buckled and call it to your attention you and they passed the not buckled test the image of little voice popping up behind me unknowingly had me rolling on the floor it was so terrifying did it to my mom when was at in the morning and scared her so bad she punched me right in the face she just watched the silence of the lambs that night and was on edge which of course didn know it is to date one of the funniest stories of my childhood did this once and pulled over in god damn panic to buckle her in baby brezza love that thing dude teach her to buckle not sure how old she is but mine was so happy and proud of herself when she buckled herself it is definitely time consuming and you ll have to pull the strap tight but worth trying out while you have some time to kill was in the shower this morning with my kiddo and kinda in daze after squeezing big glob of shampoo onto her head realized just used the dog shampoo thankfully it gentle shampoo but she now smells like my golden retriever all day mommyfail did this to my mom as kid unbuckled and gave her surprise hug from behind while she was driving right by cop sorry mom totally did this on road trip with my at the time month old we had stopped at rest stop so could feed him after fed him put him back in his seat went inside to use the bathroom came back out and drove off two hours later when it was time to feed him again we stopped and realized that had never buckled him in casually flying down the interstate for two whole hours not buckled in he is now years old and is very adamant on being buckled in at all times did the cop see oh yeah she got pulled over she managed to convince the cop that she really did have me buckled in and was just stubborn toddler who didn want to be still this was the late 70 so imagine things were bit more lax yes me too we exclusively formula fed so it was life saver has happened more than once and my toddler always reminded us we ended up teaching her how to buckle herself which made getting in the car quicker since her little sister needs help there was this one time when my oldest was an infant and was visiting my mom out of state strapped my lo into her car seat placed it on the back seat and drove off without strapping the car seat to the seat luckily it was short trip and everything was okay became ocd about that afterwards 😂😂😂😂😂😂😂😂 definitely did this when my son was about months old we had taken him out to restaurant for dinner and when he started to eat tired just plopped him down in the car seat unbuckled to sleep he had blanket on him and totally forgot about the buckles and drove home which was thankfully only lt 10 min drive on side streets still freaked me out when we got home though have always taught my boys from infancy safety first while buckling them in have forgotten to buckle them in few times lol it happens and once had moved my son carseat and forgot to buckle the actual carseat it my son was buckled into the carseat while the carseat was on its side he was giggling his butt off while my sister and were horrified and trying to find safe place to pull over lmao it happens do consider it failure just laugh it off and keep pushing put my daughter in her stroller when she was months old and forgot to buckle her in because had turned around to grab the baby bag and my wallet in the front seat she was kicking and playing and then all of sudden slipped right out luckily she landed on her butt and just looked at me super confused like how did that just happen whoops once years ago was starting to buckle my son in his seat and he dropped toy picked it up from the parking lot and totally forgot to finishing buckling him when we got in our garage noticed had only put the straps on his shoulders and hadn latched them he was fast asleep in the seat car even swiped by me when we were on our street barely touching my driver side mirror have never done that again and it has haunted me ever since forgive yourself mama trying to do the same agree my dad always tells the story of when was an infant and he had not buckled me into my seat ended up on the floor of the car thankfully not hurt lol that not fail she still clean my mum once forgot to put the car in park as she was trying to unload groceries from the car the car started rolling away with me still in my car seat vigilant bystander managed to jump in the front seat and throw the brake before we rolled into traffic was none the wiser this sumner ve been biking my toddler to and from daycare just days ago get home and realized didn buckle him into his seat the whole way home daddy is never finding out did that two weeks ago same thing got the kids from daycare and in the car fixed my daughter hair and forgot to buckle her we were halfway down the road and she just gasped and said mommy not buckled we were close to home so just had her buckle the chest piece that she can do herself and got us home it happens we are all too tired flew with our daughter at months baby in arms got the car seat and stroller at the gate and wheeled around to get our luggage took the tram to the rental car place got her seat all strapped in drove 25 or so miles for lunch went to get her out of her car seat at the restaurant not buckled in melted down while dad did his best to calm me an older woman overheard our realization came up to us and shared that her kids never had car seats and all of them turned out fine she bought our lunch and told us we re doing great job thought my mom and his parents were more helpful than they are evidently getting her in her carseat does actually mean buckling her in when it does mean them getting her buckled it takes forever even after two week stay also when grandparents are in the backseat it almost guaranteed they will also unbuckle the carseat when they get out ve been trying to put bags and such in the seat that shares the buckle area with the carseat buckle that way they have to sit on the other side thought about zip ties for it but it only an issue with the olds also why does it take them so long to get themselves and kid in and out often out unbuckled the kid and gotten the kid and all the bags out of the trunk unlocking the door to my house before they even have their car door open just did this yesterday thankfully my daughter let me know that win still she clean few weeks ago took both kids to the grocery store the yr old climbed in her seat from the baby door buckled the baby loaded the groceries into the trunk put the cart away and got into my seat my yr old leaned between the driver and passenger seat and said calmly you forgot to buckle me startled me so much screamed little lol definitely have done this with both my kids only once with my son and once so far with my daughter yeah ve forgotten to buckle my year old couple times and the first time she didn even tell me the next time she waited until we were to the end of the street and said mooooom guess what you forgot to buckle me in 🤦🏻‍♀️ my week old ca even roll over but he managed to wiggle himself off the couch while was peeing this morning thank god he landed on our 140 lb gentle giant great pyrenees who just laid there with him on her side till got in there they were just chilling totally freaked and he will be on the rug in the bathroom or his playmat on the floor from now on when im in the restroom my husband always did daycare drop off except one morning he was sick so agreed to take my then month old to daycare was out of my mind exhausted and she fell asleep right away was 10 minutes on my drive to work before suddenly remembered had her and needed to go to the daycare the cold feeling of dread melting over my heart realizing was maybe 20 minutes away from leaving my baby in hot car was one of the worst feelings ve ever had ever since then put my work badge in her car seat so could get into the building without finding her just yesterday was putting my 10 month old son to bed when he had poopy diaper so laid him on the floor changed him and he rolled over and crawled out of the room into the hallway dh thinking we were in the bedroom went in the basement and did close the door behind him thinking the basement door was closed was super quick about following ds into the hallway when walked into the hallway he was already at the top of the basement stairs looking down them yelled to keep him from moving forward which scared him into crying but at least kept him from falling down the stairs my dd was around 6m and we lived in florida we had just went grocery shopping and got to the car my car didn have key fob this was many years ago lol so opened the passenger seat reached tbru and started the car so the ac would start cooling it down shut the passenger door put all the groceries in the trunk shut it then put dd in her seat and shut the door had locked every damn door as shut it keys in the ignition at least the ac was running and she was cool so stood in front of her window blocking the sun until my dh could get there and unlock the car it been almost 17 years my cars have key fobs now and still make it habit to leave the keys on the top of the car while loading it almost pulled off without buckling my four year old and she tells me the tale of that day like twice week this happened to me when she was in her travel system with blanket on top this is why my husband came up with very strict rule that if our baby is in their infant car seat they are buckled period it is good rule to have it is so easy to forget that you unbuckled them glad it worked out maybe she ll follow commands better today is it possible to get the carseat installed with latch instead of the belt that way they at least stop accidentally uninstalling it and totally feel you on the slowness though we have the clip things through the back and on top so not sure if the seatbelt really does anything in all actuality but it been tested to safety regulations with the assumption it installed properly directions say to use both just need the rents to be more mindful not me but my friend and went out somewhere my son was in his seat one of the bigger ones and she had her son in his infant seat without the base got to wherever we were going and she realized she had actually strapped the seat in mom brain got so used to just plopping the seat into base it was super short drive like we could ve walked there in under 10 min if we were so lazy lol but thank god nothing happened helllooooo clariceeeeee that funny
